Oran's beautiful sea shore, constructed under French rule, was inspired by Nice's seafront. It consists of a long boulevard lined with cafés, restaurants, and ice cream shops. The boulevard also offers a splendid view of the sea, the harbour, Santa Cruz and the cliffs ("les Falaises"). It has been renamed "Boulevard de l'ALN" by the government after the independence but it is still called

Oran is at the western terminus of the Algerian rail network, there is a line continuing towards
but it has been closed for decades due to political conflicts. Trains from the capital
are plentiful however with several services daily.
One can also reach Oran by ferries from the ports of Marseilles, Sète, Alicante and Almería, via the national company Algérie Ferries.

Oran's nightlife is among the most thriving in the continent. The city has always been the capital of Algeria's parties and music. All night long, plenty of nightclubs, bars and cabarets are opened and offer music, dance and partying in the city area seafront, called
to the neighbouring cities of Aïn El Turk, Bou Sfer and El Ançor. All kinds of nightclubs can be found, from the very posh
at the Sheraton Hotel that attracts now international DJs such as David Vendetta to more popular ones in the Corniche.

content=The best among budget hotel in the town. Friendly staff, clean, shared bathroom, hot shower, air conditioning.

content=A 4 star hotel located in the centre of the town, free wifi, breakfast, nice and big room with western standard facility. the only small problem is the staff speak little english but very friendly, very good in french and arabia,

content=Situated on a high cliff with a stunning view over the Mediterranean Sea and the city centre of Oran. The hotel will form part of a larger complex including an adjacent conference and exhibition centre, and an oceanfront promenade.
content=Luxorius hotel located in central Oran, not far from the docks. Often rated as great value for money
content=One of the fanciest hotels in Oran with breathtaking views of the ocean from each room. The hotel also features a complimentary airport shuttle, restaurants and a tennis court
